desc: This course examines and analyzes religious beliefs, meanings, rituals, and organizational patterns from an empirical perspective. Students study the social organization and functions of religion, the process of secularization in society, the practice and function of civil religion, religious conversion and defection, and sectarian religious movements. Offered annually in the Fall or Spring Semester.
name: Rel, Culture, Society
notes: Closed to First-Year Students exception with permission of the instructor.
title: Religion, Culture and Society
